roleset.name: risk, attempt, try
roleset.note: RISK-V NOTES: VN class Risk-94-1. (from risk.01-v)
RISK-N NOTES: Based on verb entry risk.01. Corresponds to VNclass risk-94-1. (from risk.01-n)

role.descr: thing in jeopardy, asset that could be lost, or negative outcome risked

example.name: risk-v: transitive
example.text: They may, however, risk bringing some damaging interference from outside the markets.
example.arg: bringing some damaging interference from outside the markets

example.name: risk-v: with manner
example.text: Few, if any, index-fund managers will risk leveraging performance by owning more than 100% exposure to stocks.
example.arg: by owning more than 100 % exposure to stocks

example.name: risk-n: both args
example.text: But traders who *trace* risk money handling big blocks of stock were shaken.

example.name: risk-n: transitive
example.text: It said that the `` temptation for managements to ease this profit pressure by *PRO* taking greater risks is anadditionalrating factor . ''

example.name: risk-n: arg1
example.text: James's willingness to listen, his risking of ridicule, his spiritually democratic openness, still moves us to let them all in.

roleset.name: risk, attempt, try
roleset.note: RISKY-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file forunification. (from risky.01-j)

role.descr: thing in jeopardy, asset that could be lost, or negative outcome risked

example.name: risky-j: arg2
example.text: ordering drugs through the mail or over the Internet from other countries is risky for your health and is usually against thelaw.
example.arg: ordering drugs through the mail or over the Internet

example.name: risky-j: arg0
example.text: Walking alone down the dark alley was risky of her
example.arg: Walking alone down the dark alley
